title: UCSB Carpentry Workshop Survey Responses
text:
This site provides de-identified survey responses from learners who attended UCSB Library Carpentry workshops.
Source code and data are available in the GitHub repo.



2022 Fall

title: Fall 2022 Workshop Survey Responses
text:
library("tidyverse")

# list of workshop IDs to filter results
workshops <- c("2022-10-11-ucsb-spreadsheets",
               "2022-10-18-ucsb-bash-git",
               "2022-10-25-ucsb-intro-R",
               "2022-11-08-ucsb-reproducible-pubs")

results <- read_csv("data-joined/all_workshops.csv") %>% 
  filter(workshop %in% workshops)

title: Fall 2022 Workshop Survey Responses
text:

results %>% select(dept_select.pre) %>% 
  separate_rows(dept_select.pre, sep=",") %>% 
  group_by(dept_select.pre) %>%
  summarise(count=n()) %>%
  arrange(desc(count))

title: Fall 2022 Workshop Survey Responses
text:
Hopes

results %>% group_by(workshop) %>% 
  select(workshop, hopes.pre) %>% 
  drop_na()









workshop
hopes.pre




2022-10-11-ucsb-spreadsheets
Data Organization in Spreadsheets! We work with head/gate counts so reporting the data is important for Library funding.


2022-10-11-ucsb-spreadsheets
Please give my seat to someone else if you are running out of room.


2022-10-11-ucsb-spreadsheets
I hope to get an idea of what I might be able to accomplish with these skills, and to learn whehter I should be able to assist library patrons with such tasks.


2022-10-11-ucsb-spreadsheets
I would like to have a better understanding so I can help connect researchers with library services.


2022-10-11-ucsb-spreadsheets
Better Data collection, storage, issues


2022-10-11-ucsb-spreadsheets
programming


2022-10-11-ucsb-spreadsheets
I am looking for new and unique ways to help arrange, process, and visualize the data I plan to collect. I really want to learn to manage and analyze data efficiently in any way that I can. I’m very interested in digital humanities as a sub-field of history and have seen some fascinating projects come out of data analysis and programming, so I’m hoping to learn about how to make these myself.


2022-10-11-ucsb-spreadsheets
How to organize data.


2022-10-11-ucsb-spreadsheets
Refresh/remind, new tips/skills


2022-10-18-ucsb-bash-git
Version control and batch processes


2022-10-18-ucsb-bash-git
Git version control and managing coding projects through git


2022-10-18-ucsb-bash-git
Although I use the unix shell a lot, I have never had any formal training, so I think this will be helpful to make sure I am doing everything correctly. I will also most likely have to use Git in the future for my work, so I would love to learn how to use it properly.


2022-10-25-ucsb-intro-R
Relearn the basics of R


2022-10-25-ucsb-intro-R
I want to build my comfort with R so that I no longer feel like a dinosaur when working with my graduate students on data analyses.


2022-10-25-ucsb-intro-R
I hope to be able to use R for 1) exploration and analysis of data in content-linked tables and 2) production of summary tables and graphs for journal submissions.


2022-10-25-ucsb-intro-R
I hope to learn how to represent data with figures using R.


2022-10-25-ucsb-intro-R
I teach about datafication, big data, and data journalism in theory, so at a basic level I would like to understand the practice side better. But if I could learn how to do text mining and text analysis with R packages, that would be helpful to my own research directly.


2022-10-25-ucsb-intro-R
Hope to get started with using R to better analyze and visualize data.


2022-10-25-ucsb-intro-R
R basics. How to “import” a worksheet and work on it, at a basic level.


2022-10-25-ucsb-intro-R
Become proficient at using R and applying readily available data analysis packages


2022-10-25-ucsb-intro-R
data wrangling…combining large observational datasets together efficiently


2022-10-25-ucsb-intro-R
Learn a new skill and use basic R.


2022-10-25-ucsb-intro-R
Data analysis and ways of representing my data professionally. I will be involved in metagenomic and DNA analysis, I want to be prepared before that mass of data arrives.


2022-10-25-ucsb-intro-R
using programming to answer statistical questions


2022-10-25-ucsb-intro-R
learn R programming to perform RNA seq data analysis


2022-10-25-ucsb-intro-R
Optimizing data storage and organization


2022-10-25-ucsb-intro-R
move away from using excel macros… if possible


2022-10-25-ucsb-intro-R
The basics of R


2022-10-25-ucsb-intro-R
I really want to learn more about how to effectively manage data through programming skills, and to use programming skills to visualize data in various ways.


2022-10-25-ucsb-intro-R
Learn skill about data analysis and coding


2022-10-25-ucsb-intro-R
The basics to continue improving my skillset once the workshop is over.


2022-10-25-ucsb-intro-R
Some skills that i can transfer to my current and future data analysis!


2022-10-25-ucsb-intro-R
programming skills in R and R studio


2022-10-25-ucsb-intro-R
I have worked with R some but I am hoping to become more comfortable with the program to the point where I could solve a technical problem without searching on the internet


2022-10-25-ucsb-intro-R
data analysis and creating visual graphs


2022-10-25-ucsb-intro-R
how to use R for data analysis and figure making in my thesis


2022-10-25-ucsb-intro-R
Understand how data are stored


2022-11-08-ucsb-reproducible-pubs
improved workflow


2022-11-08-ucsb-reproducible-pubs
How to make publication-worthy products


2022-11-08-ucsb-reproducible-pubs
Background concept of why coding in a specific way. Good habits of organizing data and then analyze data.


2022-11-08-ucsb-reproducible-pubs
Learn basics of making reproducible publications for implementation in STEM research for current and future jobs


2022-11-08-ucsb-reproducible-pubs
Anything


2022-11-08-ucsb-reproducible-pubs
I really want to learn to do more data analysis so I can make my data processing more efficient.


2022-11-08-ucsb-reproducible-pubs
I expect I will learn a lot! My only experience using R is in the previous workshop, “Data analysis and visualization in R.” I am following up on reviewing course material from that.


2022-11-08-ucsb-reproducible-pubs
how to make great visual graph etc


2022-11-08-ucsb-reproducible-pubs
I want to refresh my skills to implement into my current research work.


2022-11-08-ucsb-reproducible-pubs
creating reproducible publications

title: Fall 2022 Workshop Survey Responses
text:
Instructor interaction example

results %>% 
  group_by(workshop) %>% 
  select(workshop, instructor_example.post) %>%
  drop_na()









workshop
instructor_example.post




2022-10-11-ucsb-spreadsheets
The instructors were very knowledgeable about what they were teaching but sometimes took a little too long on a certain topic or got distracted by adding additional information that wasn’t immediately relevant. As a result, the workshop ran over the allocated time. I had no problem staying, but many people had to leave.


2022-10-18-ucsb-bash-git
Seth went out of his way to research the answers to the very specific questions I asked. It was really fun talking about how bash scripts work and how to do version control and how the conventions are.


2022-10-18-ucsb-bash-git
instructor gave nice graphic explanation to help me understand abstract concept


2022-10-18-ucsb-bash-git
They were very responsive to questions and ensured everyone was always caught up!


2022-10-18-ucsb-bash-git
Instructors clearly explained the promised topics, provided useful applications examples, and helped with troubleshooting as we followed along. They listened carefully to questions and provided thoughtful answers based on their expertise. I feel comfortable applying the bash scripting techniques immediately and feel much more up to speed on Git basics– enough to experiment with it on my own in the future.


2022-10-25-ucsb-intro-R
I cant remember names. All the instructors were available for answering questions and did it very well.


2022-10-25-ucsb-intro-R
One instructor was very helpful and walked me through the problem solving process to fix coding issues. Another instructor was not as helpful and gave cursory overview of a possible solution.


2022-10-25-ucsb-intro-R
She explained well and show how to solve my problems


2022-10-25-ucsb-intro-R
The TA around are super helpful, they help debug very quickly so I can catch up with class


2022-10-25-ucsb-intro-R
the stickies really helped when I had small typos or questions and felt weird about disrupting the whole workshop to ask a question


2022-10-25-ucsb-intro-R
The pace was challenging since I have limited experience with coding and none with R. However, the instructors are very responsive and very good at efficiently providing clarity and help. Key was the green and red post-it method for providing feedback and getting help on the fly.


2022-11-08-ucsb-reproducible-pubs
They do stop and help with my questions or bug. Follow up later if they do not know the answer right away.


2022-11-08-ucsb-reproducible-pubs
Instructors and helpers were prompt to answer all questions and flexible in learning lessons to accommodate unanticipated issues/errors that came up when running code, especially being that this is a new workshop.


2022-11-08-ucsb-reproducible-pubs
All extremely helpful and patient, lots of one on one time


2022-11-08-ucsb-reproducible-pubs
All of the new information can be overwhelming and so easy to fall behind, but all instructors provided excellent efficient one-on-one help. This was their first time teaching the course, so of course, there were challenges that arose for the teaching group–they had to to troubleshoot and try to solve. For the most part, the teachers kept on track. It is necessary to go through the guide on our own. I appreciate that it is well written. Thank you all!


2022-11-08-ucsb-reproducible-pubs
I felt comfortable asking clarifying questions even if the material had been covered. Also, a few instructors walked me through issues I was having.


2022-11-08-ucsb-reproducible-pubs
Renata answered a question for me about Rpub.

title: Fall 2022 Workshop Survey Responses
text:
Workshop Strengths

results %>% 
  group_by(workshop) %>% 
  select(workshop, workshop_strengths.post) %>% 
  drop_na()









workshop
workshop_strengths.post




2022-10-11-ucsb-spreadsheets
Thorough, thoughtful, interactive


2022-10-11-ucsb-spreadsheets
time to explore the exercises with a partner was a nice interaction.


2022-10-18-ucsb-bash-git
Specific questions were answered. We received a lot of one-on-one guidance because it was so small.


2022-10-18-ucsb-bash-git
Easy to catch up for a beginner. Our problems can be solved immediately.


2022-10-18-ucsb-bash-git
’-the small workshop size I thought actually made it better for my personal learning; -the flexibility of the instructors meant all of my questions were answered


2022-10-18-ucsb-bash-git
Good coverage of topics and examples; Instructor expertise; Friendly, inviting atmosphere


2022-10-25-ucsb-intro-R
That you can walk without ever having used R and still be able to catch everything that’s being discussed.


2022-10-25-ucsb-intro-R
Allowed time to focus solely on the workshop topic.


2022-10-25-ucsb-intro-R
Well prepared


2022-10-25-ucsb-intro-R
Very packed and pace well and I learn a lot. I do work with R before (plots and easy data cleaning) and looking at the introduction I thought it’s too intro-level for me. But! It turns out that I learn so much because it dived much deeper even in the first day. In general, it is super useful for my current research.


2022-10-25-ucsb-intro-R
Best for total novices, the pacing was nice and slow!


2022-10-25-ucsb-intro-R
in-person and interactive; focus on a real data set for research


2022-10-25-ucsb-intro-R
the figure making portion was the most helpful part


2022-10-25-ucsb-intro-R
The workshop notes and the roaming instructors providing help on the fly are effective and essential.


2022-11-08-ucsb-reproducible-pubs
Clarity, good doable pace


2022-11-08-ucsb-reproducible-pubs
Good instructor to student ratio


2022-11-08-ucsb-reproducible-pubs
interesting/important topic that is not taught a lot in STEM fields, knowledgable instructors, practical skills/advice


2022-11-08-ucsb-reproducible-pubs
’-Number of helpers; -lots of different aspects covered; -new technology


2022-11-08-ucsb-reproducible-pubs
Teaching team works well together. All very conscientious and helpful providing one-on-one. All good at lecture and discussion.


2022-11-08-ucsb-reproducible-pubs
’-material ; -number of helpers


2022-11-08-ucsb-reproducible-pubs
The instructors were very well-organized.

title: Fall 2022 Workshop Survey Responses
text:
Ways to improve the workshop

results %>% 
  group_by(workshop) %>% 
  select(workshop, workshop_improved.post) %>% 
  drop_na()









workshop
workshop_improved.post




2022-10-11-ucsb-spreadsheets
Better organization from the instructors would help things flow more smoothly.


2022-10-11-ucsb-spreadsheets
time management and organization of the materials so that it could be presented smoothly.


2022-10-18-ucsb-bash-git
Depending on the size, I would say restructuring it to be more of a seminar/discussion type was more appealing for the last 2 days of the workshop to me. I felt I got a lot more out of it.


2022-10-18-ucsb-bash-git
maybe more effective ad for more students to attend. also, sometimes it just hard to find a free schedule for 3 consecutive days for students.


2022-10-18-ucsb-bash-git
It was sad it almost got cancelled! Some advertisement improvements could be made to ensure at least a slightly larger attendance. At least enough to make it financially viable


2022-10-18-ucsb-bash-git
The workshop was great. More time with the instructors– another day or two– would have been valuable. For additional hands on experience with some of the concepts and to dig into more sophisticated aspects of those.


2022-10-25-ucsb-intro-R
Becoming part of a series of increasingly more complex workshops.


2022-10-25-ucsb-intro-R
Provide a better/more in-depth introduction into the R program. For someone new to R, there was little explanation of navigating around the various interfaces or the symbols, terminology, and script used. The exercises/challenges would also be more helpful if they were presented in a stepwise manner (like building blocks). I think it would also be more helpful for it to be more exercise or active participation based, rather than following along with what the instructor is typing. I didn’t feel there was sufficient time to code and keep up with information, especially if there was an error with my code.


2022-10-25-ucsb-intro-R
Will be great if refreshments are provided


2022-10-25-ucsb-intro-R
more practice time? A third session for people to play more with data or bring their own datasets and questions would be great


2022-10-25-ucsb-intro-R
Maybe distribute some very basic resources or handouts for people to read before the class so some people can be better prepared and students may be relative on the same page.


2022-10-25-ucsb-intro-R
more time on figure making


2022-10-25-ucsb-intro-R
Try to follow and stay on topic with the workshop notes, because the notes are very important for reviewing what was presented, reviewing what I was able to do hands on, and filling in gaps of understanding when I wasn’t able to keep up or lost track.


2022-11-08-ucsb-reproducible-pubs
working out the kinks of Quarto and warning students beforehand of potential problem areas


2022-11-08-ucsb-reproducible-pubs
Mention some pre-requisition knowledge may need in the workshop


2022-11-08-ucsb-reproducible-pubs
timing of lessons was a little ambitious


2022-11-08-ucsb-reproducible-pubs
’-more time spent on examples maybe; -start from scratch more often


2022-11-08-ucsb-reproducible-pubs
’-more step by step instructions ; -point out more where we are in the lesson in case people get lost

title: Fall 2022 Workshop Survey Responses
text:
Topic Suggestions

results %>% 
  group_by(workshop) %>% 
  select(workshop, suggest_topics.post) %>% 
  drop_na()









workshop
suggest_topics.post




2022-10-11-ucsb-spreadsheets
More about data analysis! I’d love to attend an R or Python workshop.


2022-10-18-ucsb-bash-git
time series data analysis using R


2022-10-18-ucsb-bash-git
Pandas dataframes in Python, intro to Julia, and how to use the cluster (although I know there is already a seminar on that this week!)


2022-10-25-ucsb-intro-R
Modelling in R.


2022-10-25-ucsb-intro-R
Introduction to the basics of R.


2022-10-25-ucsb-intro-R
Python and github


2022-10-25-ucsb-intro-R
Just an open workshop for beginners to bring their own datasets and the needs they have would be great


2022-10-25-ucsb-intro-R
python for data science or image analysis


2022-10-25-ucsb-intro-R
more time on figure making and more complex statistical analysis


2022-10-25-ucsb-intro-R
Consider expanding the introductory course to 3 days so that we have better understanding of how a project is organized in R, how we manage multiple datasets within one project, merging datasets, checking data, and how we can access and use packages and scripts created by others for statistical analysis and visualization. Another workshop topic: GIS and creating maps in R (or ArcGIS).


2022-11-08-ucsb-reproducible-pubs
spatial mapping topics in R


2022-11-08-ucsb-reproducible-pubs
Python, anaconda, and R


2022-11-08-ucsb-reproducible-pubs
N/A


2022-11-08-ucsb-reproducible-pubs
’-more on R code commands; -more examples for each commands


2022-11-08-ucsb-reproducible-pubs
Specific clean data in R for social science students. Cleaning example: Like how to merge data in R, how to append data in R. How to manipulate variables.


2022-11-08-ucsb-reproducible-pubs
Graphing and visualizing data
